intro: Polyalthia dumosa, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
